prompt:
Nurse: Excellent, thank you for your time, Mr. Valenzuela. How has your day been so far?

Patient: Day has been pretty good. A little worried about the upcoming seizure, but all in all a good day.

Nurse: I'm glad to hear that you're having a good day, Mr. Valenzuela. It's completely normal to have some worries about upcoming medical procedures. How are you feeling about your colonoscopy procedure?

Patient: Well, I know it's not gonna be pleasant. But it should be over pretty quickly. And then hopefully, will have an answer as to why I've been having my my issues.

Nurse: Absolutely, Mr. Valenzuela. It's quite a process to go through this procedure, but it's great that you're hoping for some answers to your unexplained and long-lasting diarrhea. Before we begin, do you have any specific questions or concerns you'd like to discuss?

Patient: I don't think so.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. Valenzuela. Please remember that you can ask me questions at any time during our conversation. I see on your chart that you're getting this colonoscopy for unexplained and long-lasting diarrhea. We hope this procedure gives you and your doctor the answers you're looking for. Would it be okay if we go over a few topics on prep for your colonoscopy?

Patient: You certainly may do that. Yes.

responses.gpt4: Great, thank you, Mr. Valenzuela. Our aim today is to ensure that you have all the details and support you need for your upcoming colonoscopy. I will also be calling you again the day before your procedure to check in. Let's talk about how you can prepare for your procedure. Shall we begin with the dietary adjustments you need to make?
responses.our_model: Great, thank you, Mr. Valenzuela. I'm calling today to ensure you have everything you need for your colonoscopy. We will also have another call the day before your procedure. Let's start with the first item on our checklist. Are you clear on the dietary restrictions you need to follow before your colonoscopy?
